basics.name: Austin Guest
basics.label: Programmer
basics.summary: Self-taught full-stack programmer who has learned five languages, test-driven development, mobile development, basic algorithms, Agile, and functional programming in just under three years. Looking to continue building my toolkit and work on distributed systems with a team of friendly inquisitive people that are looking for a fast learner.

highlights: Designed and wrote prototype for full-stack realtime location sharing app, including native Android client, React-based web client, and Scala-based server using recently pioneered reactive programming paradigms
Coached, reviewed code, and built consensus around architecture and decign decisions with team of eight mid-level developers
Received mentorship in threat-modeling, cryptography, and security training from senior ACLU security technologists
Designed and wrote full automated testing suite, including unit, integration, and load tests
Raised thousands of dollars in donations through handrolled Stripe-based extension to ghost.js blogging platform

Managing migration from native Android code base to hybrid iOS/Android React-Native stack using Redux for state management and FOSS alternatives to GoogleMaps and LocationProviders for enhanced security
Managing migration to continuous integration environment leveraging Go-CD, Docker, AWS, and eclips.is
Designed and implemented user interface for vizualizing networks of corporate power as 'slide decks' of interactive maps interspersed with text
Re-designed the creation/editing interface for network maps and created plan to port from D3/jQuery to React

work.summary: Mastered basic best practices in functional programming in Scala and JavaScript
highlights: Wrote non-blocking chat server in Scala, using futures and a custom wrapper around Java’s NIO2 library
Began work on a Scala BitTorrent client, including custom parser combinators and non-blocking socket IO
Wrote Node app for parsing and storing real estate data using a recursive interpreter pattern to enhance composability
Completed readings and exercises on algorithms, data structures, function composition, monads, concurrency, and recursion

work.summary: Learned full-stack web development, test-driven development, and agile project management
highlights: Learned Ruby and built full-stack Rails app in 3 months
Automated conflict-checking and shift allocation procecures
Reduced time needed to allocate 300-400 weekly shifts to 100-150 riders by over 50%

Used 1-week Agile sprints to ensure continuous deployment of usable features, front-load completion of learning-rich user stories, provide client with a burn-up chart to facilitate budgeting decisions

work.summary: Deployed and iterated on complex systems approaches to large-scale social change
highlights: Conceived and project-managed Occupy The Boardroom, a web app that sent and displayed personal emails from ordinary people directly to the CEOs of the “Big Six” banks
Coordinated Occupy Sandy’s needs assessment canvass in the Far Rockaways, including design and implementation of distributed data-input system to support to overtaxed on-the-ground coordinators
Used NYC’s OpenData portal to research property ownership in Crown Heights in support of ongoing affordable housing campaigns; used research to write pamphlets, conduct teach-ins
Coordinated tactical framework development, trainings and communications infrastructure for mass mobilizations of tens of thousands of people in NYC’s financial district

work.summary: Managed online strategy for successful citywide campaign to keep Walmart out of New York City
highlights: Generated 30,000 YouTube views for videos of flash mobs targeting possible Walmart business partners
Grew email list by 38%, Twitter following by 133%, Facebook group from 0 to 1250
Designed Facebook Ad program averaging $.30 Cost-Per-Acquisition rate
Led seminars at national conferences on Facebook Ad metrics for other grassroots organizations
Administered Wordpress site and CiviCRM database
